alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Clark; Darke; Mercer; Miami; Montgomery; Shelby (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:01AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SHELBY, WESTERN CHAMPAIGN, DARKE, NORTHWESTERN CLARK, NORTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY, SOUTHERN MERCER AND MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 AM EDT... At 1201 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near West Milton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Huber Heights, Troy, Trotwood, Sidney, Piqua, Vandalia, Englewood, Greenville, Tipp City, New Carlisle, West Milton, Versailles, Covington, St. Henry, St. Paris, Newport, Bradford, Union City and Anna. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 27 and 41. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 56 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Champaign; Clark; Darke; Mercer; Miami; Montgomery; Shelby
